item.title: Pythagorean Triples
item.description: In a quiet moment, I happened across Project Eulerâ€™s Question 39: Integer right triangles Problem 39 If \(p\) is the perimeter of a right angle triangle with integral length sides, \(\{a,b,c\}\), there are exactly three solutions for \(p = 120\): \[\{20,48,52\}, \{24,45,51\}, \{30,40,50\}\] For which value of \(p \le 1000\), is the number of solutions maximised? Put another way, what integer perimeter less than or equal to 1000 has the most Pythagorean triples?
